Frontend Architectureâ€‹

Technology Stackâ€‹

  • Framework: React 18
  • Language: TypeScript
  • Build Tool: Vite
  • Styling: Tailwind CSS
  • State Management: React Context API
  • HTTP Client: Fetch API

Directory Structureâ€‹

src/
â”œâ”€â”€ components/          # Reusable React components
â”œâ”€â”€ pages/              # Page components

â”œâ”€â”€ App.tsx            # Main app component

Key Featuresâ€‹

  • âœ… Responsive design
  • âœ… Dark mode support
  • âœ… Session-based authentication
  • âœ… Real-time data updates
  • âœ… Accessibility compliance

Backend Architectureâ€‹

Technology Stackâ€‹

  • Framework: Express.js
  • Language: TypeScript
  • Runtime: Node.js 20+
  • Database: Supabase (PostgreSQL)
  • Authentication: Session-based with bcrypt

Directory Structureâ€‹

server/
â”œâ”€â”€ routes/            # API route handlers
â”œâ”€â”€ middleware/        # Express middleware
â”œâ”€â”€ db/               # Database utilities
â”œâ”€â”€ types/            # TypeScript types
â”œâ”€â”€ utils/            # Utility functions
â””â”€â”€ index.ts          # Server entry point

API Endpointsâ€‹

  • POST /api/auth/login - User login
  • POST /api/auth/logout - User logout
  • GET /api/auth/session - Get current session
  • GET /api/sites - List sites
  • POST /api/sites - Create site
  • PUT /api/sites/:id - Update site
  • DELETE /api/sites/:id - Delete site
  • POST /api/sites/import - Import sites
  • GET /api/api-keys - List API keys
  • POST /api/api-keys - Create API key
  • DELETE /api/api-keys/:id - Revoke API key

Authentication Flowâ€‹

1. User submits login form
   â†“
2. Backend validates credentials
   â†“
3. Backend creates session
   â†“
4. Session token sent in HttpOnly cookie
   â†“
5. Frontend stores session in React state
   â†“
6. Subsequent requests include session cookie

Database Architectureâ€‹

Database Providerâ€‹

  • Provider: Supabase (PostgreSQL)
  • Authentication: Row Level Security (RLS)
  • Backups: Automated daily backups

Core Tablesâ€‹

  • admin_users - Admin user accounts
  • sessions - Active user sessions
  • sites - Monitored websites
  • score_history - Historical scores
  • api_keys - API keys for programmatic access
  • activity_log - Audit trail
  • api_payloads - API request payloads

Securityâ€‹

  • âœ… Row Level Security (RLS) policies
  • âœ… Bcrypt password hashing
  • âœ… HttpOnly session cookies
  • âœ… API key hashing
  • âœ… Audit logging

Data Flowâ€‹

User Login Flowâ€‹

1. User enters credentials
   â†“
2. Frontend sends POST /api/auth/login
   â†“
3. Backend validates credentials
   â†“
4. Backend creates session in database
   â†“
5. Backend sends session token in HttpOnly cookie
   â†“
6. Frontend stores session in React state
   â†“
7. User is authenticated

Site Data Flowâ€‹

1. Admin creates/updates site
   â†“
2. Frontend sends POST/PUT /api/sites
   â†“
3. Backend validates request
   â†“
4. Backend stores in database
   â†“
5. Backend logs action in activity_log
   â†“
6. Frontend updates UI

API Import Flowâ€‹

1. External service sends POST /api/sites/import with API key
   â†“
2. Backend validates API key
   â†“
3. Backend validates request payload
   â†“
4. Backend creates/updates sites
   â†“
5. Backend logs in api_payloads table
   â†“
6. Backend returns response with results

Security Architectureâ€‹

Authenticationâ€‹

  • âœ… Session-based authentication
  • âœ… HttpOnly cookies (prevents XSS)
  • âœ… Secure flag (HTTPS only)
  • âœ… SameSite flag (CSRF protection)
  • âœ… 15-day session expiration

Authorizationâ€‹

  • âœ… Row Level Security (RLS) policies
  • âœ… API key scopes (sites:read, sites:write, sites:delete)
  • âœ… Primary admin protection
  • âœ… Activity logging

Data Protectionâ€‹

  • âœ… Bcrypt password hashing
  • âœ… API key hashing
  • âœ… HTTPS/TLS encryption
  • âœ… Database backups

Scalabilityâ€‹

Horizontal Scalingâ€‹

  • Multiple frontend instances behind load balancer
  • Multiple backend instances with shared database
  • Multiple docs instances

Vertical Scalingâ€‹

  • Increase server CPU/RAM
  • Optimize database queries
  • Add caching layer

Monitoringâ€‹

Application Monitoringâ€‹

  • PM2 process monitoring
  • Application logs
  • Error tracking

System Monitoringâ€‹

  • CPU usage
  • Memory usage
  • Disk space
  • Network traffic

Database Monitoringâ€‹

  • Query performance
  • Connection pool
  • Backup status
